title: fanoutqa: What were box office values of the Star Wars films in the prequel and sequel trilogies? (2120afba8009bad3)

<fragment>

The combined box office revenue of the films amounts to over ten billion dollars, and it is currently the second-highest-grossing film franchise. The major live-action releases (including all the films within the Skywalker Saga) were nominated for Academy Awards. The original film was nominated for most of the major categories, including Best Picture, Best Director, Best Original Screenplay, and Best Supporting Actor for Alec Guinness (who played Obi-Wan Kenobi), while all theatrical live-action films have been nominated for particular categories. Several official *Star Wars* television series have also been released, all now on Disney+.







## Skywalker Saga

[edit]

The *Star Wars* franchise involves multiple live-action and animated films. The film series started with a trilogy set *in medias res* that was later expanded to a trilogy of trilogies, known as the "Skywalker Saga".


</fragment>
<fragment>

The 1977 self-titled film, later subtitled *Episode IV – A New Hope*, was followed by the sequels *The Empire Strikes Back* (1980) and *Return of the Jedi* (1983), respectively subtitled onscreen as *Episode V* and *Episode VI*; these films form the original trilogy. Sixteen years later, the prequel trilogy was released, consisting of *The Phantom Menace* (1999), *Attack of the Clones* (2002), and *Revenge of the Sith* (2005). After creator George Lucas sold *Lucasfilm* to Disney in 2012, a sequel trilogy consisting of *Episodes VII* through *IX* was released, consisting of *The Force Awakens* (2015), *The Last Jedi* (2017), and *The Rise of Skywalker* (2019).


</fragment>
<fragment>

</fragment>
<fragment>
The main *Star Wars* film series is a trilogy of subtrilogies; as it neared completion, Lucasfilm began to refer to it as the "Skywalker Saga".[1][2] It was released beginning with the original trilogy (Episodes *IV, V* and *VI*, 1977–1983), followed by the prequel trilogy (Episodes *I, II* and *III*, 1999–2005) and the sequel trilogy (Episodes *VII, VIII* and *IX*, 2015–2019).[c] The first film released, *Star Wars* (1977), is the fourth film chronologically and was later subtitled *Episode IV – A New Hope*. The saga begins chronologically with *Episode I – The Phantom Menace* (1999) and concludes with *Episode IX – The Rise of Skywalker* (2019).


</fragment>
<fragment>
1. **^** 20th Century Fox was the original studio that distributed the first 6 Star Wars movies upon their release. In 2012, Lucasfilm became a subdivision of The Walt Disney Company, releasing the new film *The Force Awakens* in 2015, distributed by Disney. Nonetheless, Fox retained the distribution rights for the original *Star Wars* for perpetuity and to the rest of the films until May 2020 as of the original deal. Disney had got full distribution rights as a result of an acquisition of 21st Century Fox in 2019.
2. **^** Additionally, and especially since Disney's acquisition of Lucasfilm, a number of announced projects have been postponed or cancelled.
3. **^** The first two trilogies were released on three-year intervals, the sequel trilogy films two years apart.

</fragment>

<fragment>

The first three spin-off films produced were the made-for-television *Star Wars Holiday Special* (1978), *The Ewok Adventure* (1984) and *Ewoks: The Battle for Endor* (1985). Following Disney's 2012 acquisition of the franchise, these earlier films were dropped from the official canon, but the theatrical animated film *Star Wars: The Clone Wars* (2008) and its television series continuation retain their canonical status. Two standalone films were produced and released between the sequel trilogy films: *Rogue One* (2016) and *Solo: A Star Wars Story* (2018), both set between the original and prequel trilogies. Untitled movies from Taika Waititi, James Mangold, Dave Filoni, and Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy have been officially announced as being written, while other unspecified films are reportedly in early stages of development.[b]


</fragment>

| *Episode VIII – The Last Jedi* | December 15, 2017 (2017-12-15) | Rian Johnson | Kathleen Kennedy and Ram Bergman | [15][16] |

## Standalone films

[edit]

As Lucas was outlining a trilogy of trilogies, he also imagined making additional movies unrelated to the Skywalker Saga.[19] The first theatrical films set outside the main episodic series were the Ewok spin-off films *Caravan of Courage: An Ewok Adventure* (1984) and *Ewoks: The Battle for Endor* (1985), the first of which was screened internationally after being produced for television.[20]


</fragment>
<fragment>

3. **^** VanDerWerff, Emily (May 19, 2019). "The Star Wars prequels are bad — and insightful about American politics". *Vox*. Archived from the original on October 10, 2020.
4. **^** Franich, Darren (November 20, 2019). "Star Wars rewatch: Why is Attack of the Clones so heartless?". *Entertainment Weekly*. Archived from the original on November 21, 2019.
5. **^** Bonomolo, Cameron (May 16, 2020). "Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones Opened 18 Years Ago Today". *Comicbook.com*. Archived from the original on June 1, 2020.
6. **^** Leadbeater, Alex (May 19, 2020). "Revenge of the Sith Is The Best Star Wars Story Ever Told (Just Not Lucas' Version)". *Screen Rant*. Archived from the original on May 29, 2020.

chat_history.name: search

chat_history.content:
Based on the search results, I can provide you with the box office figures for both the prequel and sequel trilogies:

Prequel Trilogy (Episodes I-III):
1. The Phantom Menace (1999): $1,027,082,707
2. Attack of the Clones (2002): $653,779,970
3. Revenge of the Sith (2005): $868,390,560

Sequel Trilogy (Episodes VII-IX):
1. The Force Awakens (2015): $2,071,310,218
2. The Last Jedi (2017): $1,334,407,706
3. The Rise of Skywalker (2019): $1,077,022,372

Some notable observations:
- The Force Awakens was by far the highest-grossing film of both trilogies, earning over $2 billion worldwide
- All three sequel trilogy films earned over $1 billion each
- In the prequel trilogy, only The Phantom Menace crossed the $1 billion mark
- Attack of the Clones had the lowest box office performance of both trilogies at $653.8 million
- The sequel trilogy consistently performed better at the box office compared to the prequel trilogy

These figures represent worldwide box office earnings, which include both domestic (US and Canada) and international markets.

functions.name: search
functions.desc: Search Wikipedia for an article with the given title, and get its content. If no such article is found, return similar article names.
